title: Adjunct Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Ashford University
Interview Descriptions: The first thing was a phone interview conducted by a recruiter.  I also had to respond to a list of written interview questions. Then, I was sent an email confirming that I was selected for the position.
Interview Questions: What is your philosophy of education?

title: Janitor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Ashford University
Interview Descriptions: Very thorough   had to clean the elevator shaft of oil dust debris and a few party decorations and organize a pantry. Would recommend. Speed round of 12.  Winner takes all
Interview Questions: Can you Sell me this mop

title: Enrollment Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Ashford University
Interview Descriptions: This was back in 2018, so the process has probably changed. It was a phone screening with an HR representative then an in-person interview with 2 managers. Process was very straightforward.
Interview Questions: One portion had interviewers do a “phone call” to a potential student with the manager acting like the student.

title: Online Instructor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Ashford University in Oct 2020
Interview Descriptions: The interview was virtual on indeed. It was concise and to the point. I moved on to the next step in the interview process. The person I interviewed with was very polite and professional, which made me feel more at ease.
Interview Questions: What is your teaching philosophy?

title: Adjunct Faculty Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Ashford University (New York, NY)
Interview Descriptions:
I applied and was contacted by a recruiter, was asked my teaching philosophy and experience as it relates to my field. 

Was told I was being moved on to the next phase to interview again. Never was called back even though the interview went well.
Interview Questions: Whats your teaching philosophy for teaching?

title: Instructor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Ashford University
Interview Descriptions: A process that gauges your teaching philosophy and how it will benefit students. The process really reflected  Ashford University's values. They also do a good job with training new hires and existing employees.
Interview Questions: Share with us your experience teaching online and what platforms have you used?

title: Core Faculty Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Ashford University (Cal-Ida, CA) in Jan 2020
Interview Descriptions: Recruiter call first and screen and then sets you up in a panel interview then a the provost and Dean. Recruiter interview short and screens to make sure you meet qualifications
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in this position

title: Online Adjunct Instructor Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Ashford University (Denver, CO) in Dec 2019
Interview Descriptions: A lot of deeper questions and they were untruthful by saying the job is 12-Hours a week. Good questions about work experience and life experience. They want highly qualified employees.
Interview Questions: How do you interact with people online?

title: Access and Wellness Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Ashford University
Interview Descriptions: I met in a conference room with the director and other counselors working for the Access and Wellness department. They had a list of questions they all took turns asking the questions.
Interview Questions: How do you maintain a work life balance?

title: Enrollment Services Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Ashford University (Denver, CO) in Sept 2018
Interview Descriptions: Applied online, phone screening, followed by a video call, then in person interview. Management screwed up my time for the in person interview.  I sat for over an hour waiting just to be told they scheduled me for a different time I was confirmed via email.
Interview Questions: What was your biggest accomplishment.

title: Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Ashford University in Apr 2018
Interview Descriptions: Ashford recruiter contacted me to schedule initial phone interview. Once successful, had webconference interview with Assoc Dean and panel of faculty. Second webconference interview with same panel and final interview with Executive and Assoc Dean.
Interview Questions: Course development experience / Resources I used to support my instruction

title: Admissions Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Ashford University
Interview Descriptions: It was done over Skype since I wasn't currently living in San Diego at the time. It was a typical interview. What are your greatest strengths, greatest weaknesses, tell me about a time when...
Interview Questions: What is your greatest weakness?

title: Online Associate Faculty Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Ashford University
Interview Descriptions: I was first given a "written interview" that asked me to answer a set of questions and compose statements of teaching philosophy and subject matter expertise, that then became the basis for the telephone interview that followed.
Interview Questions: What were the three most significant advantages and disadvantages of teaching online.

title: Admissions Counselor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Ashford University (San Diego, CA)
Interview Descriptions: Say they're impressed if you've worked in social service, mental health or teaching.  Then interview you only about serious sales experience.  Especially commissioned, favored if you can prove persuasion, up-selling, and getting clients to bring you friends and relatives  in the context if patting themselves (and you) on the back.
Interview Questions: See above.

title: Enrollment Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Ashford University (Denver, CO) in Apr 2017
Interview Descriptions: This was quiet the extensive interview process for a call center job. I was reached out by a recruiter via Indeed, has one phone interview with her, multiple testing, another skype interview, needed 5-7 references to respond by email immediately, and then a face to face interview. All behavior type interview questions
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time you helped someone win something but didn't get any credit for it

title: Student Mentor - Faculty Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Ashford University (Salt Lake City, UT) in Apr 2017
Interview Descriptions: Had a phone interview with a recruiter to ask preliminary questions followed by an adobe intreview the next day.  Two days later had a interview with a Senior Manager.  Did reference and background checks.  Had a job offer two days later.  Everyone was friendly which made the process very stress-free.  I was given the opportunity to showcase my skills and experience.
Interview Questions:
What do you know about WGU?
Why would WGU be a good fit for you?
How would you handle a student who is meeting his/her timeline?

title: Student Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Ashford University (New York, NY)
Interview Descriptions: Pretty straight forward ,phone then onsite and later an offer. Very corporate process and questions felt like they were out of a book. Do a general interview questions search and you should be fine.
Interview Questions: Basic questions

title: Admissions Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. I interviewed at Ashford University (New York, NY)
Interview Descriptions: phone interview plus two in person interviews. Very easy interviews but slightly unprofessional. The interview process was very casual and they hardly asked any questions. In and out in 15 minutes. Offered job on the spot but had to wait for official offer. Interview was on Thursday and started the following Monday which included two weeks of training before you are let out onto the sales floor
Interview Questions: What would you say to a student who changed their mind about pursuing their education?

title: Online Core Faculty Full-time Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Ashford University (San Diego, CA) in Aug 2016
Interview Descriptions: A Talent Acquisition specialist called unscheduled a few weeks after I applied for the position.  He talked about the position and asked about my interest.  I told him I could not quit my day job right now and asked if the hours were flexible.  He stated most definitely - nights and weekends would be great.  He then set up a formal interview with him for a few days later. During this 30 minute interview, he asked typical faculty teaching questions such as how to engage students online, etc. He then said congratulations, I was moving on to the next step.  He set up an interview with the Assistant Dean and three Program Chairs. I had to complete the formal application and obtain responses (via online reference system) from four references. I completed all of this.  During the final interview, they stated this was a full time position that would require that I quit all other employment. I stated I had asked that specific question before continuing this process - and no, that was not possible at this time. (Too close to retirement - Plus it was a reduction in salary).  They continued with questions and asked about my interest in Adjunct work. I am not sure why the Talent Acquisition person did not tell me the truth about having to quit all other employment.  This wasted many people's' time.
Interview Questions: Tell me about what you are currently doing.

title: Enrollment Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Ashford University (Denver, CO) in Feb 2016
Interview Descriptions: They talk about the job and make it seem impactful. Pretty easy interview my manager just talked about their accomplishments back in the day. Make small talk and if they like you they will hire you. They also need people so they may seem desperate to hire you.
Interview Questions: How do you handle stress?

title: Online Adjunct Instructor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Ashford University (Remote, OR) in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: The interview was a pleasant experience.  I met with the department chair via a telephone call and the interview was a nice two way discussion.  I learned more about the college and the job and was asked questions that were relevant.
Interview Questions: Goals

title: Enrollment Advisor Interview
Application Type: The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Ashford University
Interview Descriptions: I didn't apply for a position here. They contacted me and said my resume fit the position and they wanted me to do an interview. Before the interview they had me watch a video on what the position was and then when I went to the interview they said "forget what you see in the video. That's not what the position really is." It was a very underhanded attempt to get me into the interview. They also contacted one of my references asking really strange questions about his IP address, completely unrelated to the job or me. I also talked to several people after my interview who worked there who told me not to take the job. I think the reviews on here speak for themselves. Wouldnt waste your time.
Interview Questions: they have you do a role play

title: Admissions Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Ashford University (San Diego, CA)
Interview Descriptions:
Easy, Straight Forward, They want to see how positive you are and if you can carry a conversation.

There is a also  a role play where they want you to talk someone into going to school. HINT: Use open ended questions, build rapport, ask why they requested information and what assistance they need from you.
Interview Questions: What makes you a great team player?

title: Enrollment Services Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Ashford University in Aug 2015
Interview Descriptions:
- Phone interview (I was out of state)
- For those who were in- state, they were offered an in- person interview
- Three week intensive, but paid, training
- No one could miss any of the days
Interview Questions: Have you had to overcome any objections to meet goals?

title: Admissions Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Ashford University (San Diego, CA)
Interview Descriptions: Very fast, he asked me 5 or 6 basic questions and that was it. I've heard the interview process is now my in-depth. I think I hit the key notes of build string relationships with prior customers.
Interview Questions: What's my experience with rejection on the phones.

title: Enrollment Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Ashford University (San Diego, CA) in Jul 2015
Interview Descriptions:
I received an email from my recruiter, which lead to a telephonic interview. The telephonic interview was very thorough. I was asked questions off my resume and asked about experiences concerning the job itself. My recruiter provided me with a video so I could see exactly what the job entailed. This is a sit down, telephonic type of work. Basically I was asked if making phone calls and being hung up on and or negative people on the phones would be ok for yourself coming on board? My recruiter did an excellent job informing me and asking me fact finding questions to see not only if it was a good fit for them, but also if I felt is was a good job for myself.
Next step I talk to a Supervisor face to face within the organization. I was very impressed with him, I was very impressed with the office building. The interview itself was somewhat reiterated from the telephonic interview. I was also asked questions off my resume and experience and or how much college I had accomplished. I also was asked to do two role play scenarios.
Interview Questions: Do you have a problem talking on the telephone? What experiences can you tell me when a certain situation arose. Be prepared to answer from past experineces

title: Enrollment Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Ashford University (Denver, CO) in Jul 2015
Interview Descriptions: Preliminary phone interview to get to know you and ask general interview questions. Then the second step is a mock phone call with a prospective student on the line. Here the interviewee asks you questions that a prospective student might ask and brings up objections that a prospective student might have to enrolling.
Interview Questions: Mock phone call with a prospective student.

title: Online Adjunct Instructor Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Ashford University (Los Angeles, CA) in Jul 2015
Interview Descriptions: Before the telephone interview I had to answer several pre-interview questions about my teaching philosophy.  Approximately two weeks later a telephoned interview was scheduled with a recruiter who asked one question.  The entire telephone interview was a total of 15 minutes.  One week later received an offer letter.
Interview Questions: How would you address a student that turned in late assignments and wanted to drop a course?

title: Recruiter Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Ashford University (San Diego, CA) in Jul 2015
Interview Descriptions: The interview process started with a quick phone interview then an in-person interview. You were asked typical interview questions - such as why you think you would fit this role, your strengths, weaknesses, why you chose ashford and recruiting, etc.. You found out if you got the job within 24-48 hours after your interview.
Interview Questions: What is your main weakness

title: Institutional Researcher Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Ashford University
Interview Descriptions: Standard questions, your strengths and weaknesses, your experiences, your educational background. They also asked whether I am familiar with the company. If hired, what will be my contributions. They describe their work place/environment.
Interview Questions: Tell us about your experience in institutional research

title: Enrollment Service Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Ashford University (Denver, CO) in Jun 2015
Interview Descriptions:
When Ashford is hiring they use many tools for find talent to join their team. Indeed.com contacted many of the last new hires. The hiring process is so simple, anyone can become an advisor at Ashford. All you have to do is show up, be able to talk and then you are offered employment

Phone interview
In person interview
Interview Questions: Roll Play telephone conversations

title: Military Admissions Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Ashford University (San Diego, CA)
Interview Descriptions:
Phone interview followed by a call back and face to face interview.  It was described as a counseling position, when in reality it was an unofficial sales position.  If you don't make your quota in sales calls, student retention and sign-ups, you are eventually let go.  

Don't be fooled folks.  It is a business.
Interview Questions: Are you still close with all of your military contacts?

title: Financial Service Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Ashford University (San Diego, CA) in May 2015
Interview Descriptions: Very standard interview questions.  Come with lots of examples about how you handled different scenarios.  When interviewing internally for lateral or promotion positions be prepared to make a video presentation which will be reviewed by a panel of managers and directors from other departments.  The hiring process for these jobs are completely irrelevant of your job performance.  You can be the most educated and qualified but if your video does not impress and you do not do a good job during your individual interview then you might as well just look for another job elsewhere.  Company loyalty and hard work will not help you.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Admissions Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Ashford University (San Diego, CA)
Interview Descriptions: Phone then one on one interview. Easy interview simple questions about how you would answer the phone calls. Sales calls and how they require some experience with sales. It's a call center environment and also included a month long training and required to pass training before hitting floor.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Student Records Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Ashford University (San Diego, CA) in Apr 2015
Interview Descriptions: I received this interview from an Ashford recruiter who I worked with with a previous position that I applied for. She called me once it opened up, we did a phone interview that day. The next day I was scheduled for an in person interview at Ashford with a manager and a senior student records coordinator. I answered the questions with specific answers, was honest, and made sure to be myself. When I got home the recruiter called me saying the manager wants to offer me the position!
Interview Questions: How well can you multi task?

title: Student Advising Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Ashford University (Denver, CO) in Apr 2015
Interview Descriptions: very detailed process, applicants were required to provide different types of information on academic background and advising leadership. Interview in total took about 3 weeks. Process is separated and ran outside of the department. Applicants went through three separate interviews and also provided a three minute video on why they felt they were good candidates for the position.
Interview Questions: Standard interview questions

title: Adjunct Instructor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Ashford University in Apr 2015
Interview Descriptions: The initial application and pre-interview process is a bit on the long side. After you submit an application and CV, you are asked to complete a very long packet. This is before an interview; much of the information is generally only needed after you are offered the job. You have to submit official transcripts, get references submitted, etc. The interview is very short, about 20 minutes, and is completed by someone on the HR team. That is it. There is not really a time to speak with the decision maker; I suspect much of the decision is based on what is on your CV and not so much on who you are. The interview was easy, but also tough as there was just two questions.
Interview Questions: How do you engage the students?

title: Librarian Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Ashford University
Interview Descriptions:
I had two phone interviews.

First was a 30 minute phone screen with a Recruiter.  He was not able to answer any of my questions about the library, and he seemed quite indifferent to my answers.  It was like interviewing with a transcribing machine.

Second was a 1 hour conference call with three people from Library Services.  They were very nice and professional, though their questions were still pretty generic.

In both interviews, I asked about the legal issues surrounding the company as a concern about job security.  They didn't seem bothered that I asked, but I don't know whether it affected their decision not to give me an offer.
Interview Questions: How do you keep up to date on current issues in libraries? (i.e. they wanted the names of specific blogs that I read, etc.)

title: Admissions Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Ashford University (San Diego, CA) in Mar 2015
Interview Descriptions:
At first everything was moving along quickly. Applied and the next morning (wednesday) received an email from my recruiter scheduling a phone interview. Scheduled the phone interview for the next day (thursday) and had an in person interview that next day (friday). 
Interview went well a couple questions threw me off because they were worded really weirdly and then at the end has an awkward role play. The only disadvantage about the role play is that no one interviewing is trained to know how they want us to carry out the convo. All I was told was to start talking..
Following the interview my interviewer said I would hear back from my recruiter within 24-48. My interview was on a friday so I figured I would give it till tuesday that next week. Now an entire week later still-- NOTHING. I wouldn't have a problem with waiting, but the fact that I was told something and still haven't heard back at all is really unprofessional. I even emailed my recruiter with a question and have yet to hear a response. 
Haven't been offered or defined yet so the wait continues...
Interview Questions: how would you sell something to someone after they rejected it already?

title: Admissions Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Ashford University (Denver, CO) in Mar 2015
Interview Descriptions: Simple process; first contacted by phone through a talent acquisition manager then they will instruct you further and schedule your interview, you must have four former managers and or co-works fill out a skills survey and submit it once completed you are ready for your interview. The interview process is with one or two admission managers who will ask you to role play once or twice a typical phone call, you as the counselor them as the student. Once finished they will tell you what you did good and what you could have done better. From there the interview is straight forward.
Interview Questions: What would you bring to Ashford University?

title: Online ("Associate") Adjunct Instructor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Ashford University
Interview Descriptions:
The "Interview" I had was completely automated, where I was sent an "Interview Questions" document and many other auto generated emails and reminders.  Multiple layers of tasks including having references complete an online survey, paying to send all of my official transcripts directly to them etc.... BUT no one ever actually spoke to or with me, and I received an automated rejection email after spending hours completing all of these second round tasks.

Subject: Associate Faculty  - Your Time is Valuable
We understand your time is valuable and that’s why our goal is to provide you feedback as quickly as possible.  At this time, we have elected to pursue other candidate(s) for the Online Associate Faculty position.  Please accept our appreciation for the time you have dedicated to your job search within our institution(s)/organization.  We encourage you to join the conversation and visit our Career Center to stay current on all of our upcoming position(s).  
Thank you for your interest in our institution(s)/organization (Ashford University, University of the Rockies or Bridgepoint Education) and we wish you success in your future endeavors. 
Sincerely, 
Talent Acquisition
Interview Questions: What do you perceive as your greatest strengths in a teaching position?

title: Enrollment Services Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Ashford University (San Diego, CA) in Feb 2015
Interview Descriptions: Very responsive - submitted application Saturday and received an email Monday. Had a phone interview and in-person interview. The phone interview was very informative - gave realistic picture of the job and salary expectations. The in-person interview was formal yet comfortable. Interview was very personable and asked good questions about my resume. Be sure to bring a couple copies of resume. I interviewed on a college student Friday so environment was very fun and relaxed.
Interview Questions: Role Play a phone call with a potential student - very interesting and tough situation.

title: Admissions Counselor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Ashford University
Interview Descriptions:
Role play scenario. It took approximately thirty minutes.  Interviewer was on his/her phone a lot.  Did not seem like anyone there cared about student success at all.  Reminded me of wolf of wallstreet. I would not recommend this place to anyone with morals. 

The company basically takes advantage of a very specific disenfranchised socioeconomic demographic and exploit them. Ruining the US economy and placing the students in debt.
Interview Questions: Role play with a potential student over the phone.

title: Admissions Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Ashford University (San Diego, CA) in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: Phone call, in person, offer. They are pretty desperate to hire anyone as enrollment is shifting downward and outlook is negative. I had a sales background so they countered me when I refused their first offer.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Admissions Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Ashford University (San Diego, CA) in Nov 2014
Interview Descriptions: I had a interview on the phone at first which was really intense because the man who did it had no personality whatsoever, then was invited for a in-person interview ran late because the person that was supposed to interview me called in sick at the last minute, and was given a call a few days later offering me the job.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a difficult situation that you had to deal with.

title: Admissions Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Ashford University (San Diego, CA) in Oct 2014
Interview Descriptions: Started with an email, and a short phone call reviewing basics of the position from an HR rep.  Followed up by completing online personality test of some sort, as well as watching a video on a day in the life of an Ashford admissions counselor.  Once completed, I was contacted for a second phone interview with another HR rep, and then scheduled for an in-person interview.  I was interviewed by the manager who selected to hire me.
Interview Questions: We role played as if she was a prospective student

title: Admissions Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Ashford University (San Diego, CA)
Interview Descriptions: I had an initial phone interview with a recruiter who sounded very rushed and busy. I then had a face-to-face interview at their corporate headquarters at Evening Creek. The building was very nice, but the girl at the reception area seemed overworked. 1-on-1 interview with HR.
Interview Questions: Questions weren't the hardest, but were geared around my ability to recruit new students and what my motives were for getting the job. The recruiter was very nice and knew her job well. She actually worked her way up into that position.

title: Enrollment Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Ashford University (San Diego, CA) in Jun 2014
Interview Descriptions: The interview began with an initial call from a recruiter, this was helpful as he gave me a sense of what type of engagement might be necessary over the phone. The second part was a sit-down with my manager. I could tell that they were trying to see if I could hold a conversation.
Interview Questions: They guided me through a mock sales call with a prospective student.

title: Enrollment Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. I interviewed at Ashford University (Poway, CA)
Interview Descriptions: I don't remember much about the interview except that I was interviewed by a random manager.  He hired me and passed me back to the recruiter to tell me about starting.  I had applied twice online with no response.  It wasn't until I met a recruiter at a Job Fair that I finally was called for an interview.
Interview Questions: I don't remember any difficult questions.  I was primarily asked about my previous experience.

title: Enrollment Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Ashford University (San Diego, CA) in May 2014
Interview Descriptions: Very quick. On phone then in person interview. They asked basic questions about your past experiences and where you would like to be in the future. No tricky questions. Most likely the person who interviews you will be your manager.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in 5 years.

title: Adjunct Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Ashford University (San Diego, CA) in Apr 2014
Interview Descriptions: Interview is relatively brief; training process takes several weeks.  Once you are chosen you are placed in a "class" with other adjuncts to complete the training.  When you successfully complete the class you are given classes to teach.
Interview Questions: Experience, teaching strategies, teaching philosophy

title: Financial Services Manager Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Ashford University
Interview Descriptions: Interview process was more like a conversation rather than a structured interview.  Good questions were asked to see if you were a fit.
Interview Questions: Tell me a time that you had to work with a difficult customer? How did you handle it.

title: Admissions Department Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. I interviewed at Ashford University
Interview Descriptions:
I have interacted with recruiters from Ashford University twice, and both experiences were negative. The first recruiter found my profile on LinkedIn, invited me to apply to an Admissions Counselor position, and dangled a large salary and relocation packages in front of me. I decided to apply, and then heard nothing. When I followed up by email a week later, I received a canned response thanking me for applying, and informing me that Ashford is currently only hiring internally. Again, SHE contacted ME and asked me to apply, not the other way around!

The second time I contacted a recruiter to inquire about a management position posted on Ashford's web site. The recruiter responded immediately and said she would be calling me that day to talk. The next morning I emailed her because she never called. She responded by saying the position had been filled, and she would be in contact the next week. Two weeks went by and never heard back. I finally emailed to let her know I was no longer interested and would be pursuing other opportunities, to which she replied congratulations and never offered any explanation for her lack of follow-through.
Interview Questions: Never got to this point thanks to poor follow-through by their recruiters.

title: Admissions Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Ashford University (San Diego, CA) in Feb 2014
Interview Descriptions: Applied online for one position. A recruiter called to recommend a different position and ask if I was interested. I appreciated that the recruiter was open to matching my experience more closely with another and higher position than I originally applied for. One-on-one interview was unfocused. Associate Director seemed uninterested in me and in a rush. Seemed arrogant and distracted.
Interview Questions: The Associate Director started by saying we were short on time and to make my answers brief. This made answering very difficult as I felt I needed to keep it short rather than provide context and details. He just used a checklist and asked no follow up questions.

title: Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Ashford University
Interview Descriptions: Went smoothly. I was contacted through email and an interview was set up on the phone.  I completed a phone interview with HR and then with the hiring committee.
Interview Questions: Explain a difficult situation with a coworker and how I handled it.

title: Military Admissions Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Ashford University
Interview Descriptions:
First there is the initial phone call from Bridgepoint HQ then they schedule you a second phone interview.  This second phone interview has call examples, and detailed, "for example" type situations for you to respond to.
Finally, there is an in-person interview, usually with your manager.

On the day of orientation, there is a TON of people there and it's a little off-putting.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Admissions Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Ashford University (San Diego, CA) in Jan 2014
Interview Descriptions: THEY found me on LinkedIn, the process took about 3 weeks. I did an initial interview on the phone with a recruiter, then scheduled another phone interview with an HR manager. Once they decided I'd be a good fit, I was scheduled for an in-person interview with the hiring manager.
